alert.note: Alert for Brown; Butler; Clermont; Clinton; Fayette; Hamilton; Highland; Pike; Ross; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 8:18AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST OHIO AND NORTHERN KENTUCKY THROUGH 900 AM EDT... At 817 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Loveland to near Leesburg, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. The winds will likely arrive ahead of the torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Mason, Lebanon, Sharonville, Wilmington, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Montgomery, Madeira, Milford, Hillsboro, Greenfield, Blanchester, Forestville, West Chester, Amelia, Mount Orab, Mariemont, New Richmond, and Williamsburg. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 12 and 39. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 21 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
